description:
The first line of the input contains an integer $T$ (between $1$ and $10$, inclusive), which describes the number of testcases. Each testcase has 1 line, which contains a single integer $N$ (between $0$ and $20$, inclusive). 
 $0 < T \leq 10$ ,
 $0 \leq N \leq 20$

The first line of the input contains an integer $T$ (between $1$ and $100$, inclusive), which describes the number of testcases. Each testcase has 1 line, which contains a single integer $N$ (between $0$ and $1000000$, inclusive).
$0 < T \leq 100$ ,
$0 \leq N \leq 1000000$

The first line of the input contains an integer $T$ (between $1$ and $10$, inclusive), which describes the number of testcases. Each testcase has 1 line, which contains 2 integers $A$ and $B$ (both between $1$ and $9$, inclusive). 
 $0 < T \leq 10$ ,
$1 \leq A,B \leq 9$

The first line of the input contains an integer $T$ (between $1$ and $100$, inclusive), which describes the number of testcases. Each testcase has 1 line, which contains 3 integers $A$, $B$ and $C$ (between $-1000$ and $1000$, inclusive).
$0 < T \leq 100$ ,
$0 \leq |A|,|B|,|C| \leq 1000$

The first line of the input contains an integer $T$ (between $1$ and $100$, inclusive), which describes the number of testcases. Each testcase has 1 line, which contains 2 integers $A$ and $B$ (both between $0$ and $30$, inclusive), where $B$ is smaller than or equal to $A$.
$0 < T \leq 100$ ,
$0 \leq B \leq A \leq 30$

The first line of the input contains an integer $T$ (between $1$ and $100$, inclusive), which describes the number of testcases.  Each testcase consists of one line, which contains a string with length ranging from $1$ to $10^6$. Each string consists only of english alphabets in lowercase or uppercase.
$0 < T \leq 100$ , 
 $1 \leq String Length \leq 10^6$

The first line of the input contains an integer $T$ (between $1$ and $100$, inclusive), which describes the number of testcases. Each testcase has 1 line, which contains a single integer $N$ (between $0$ and $1000$, inclusive).
$0 < T \leq 100$ , 
 $0 \leq N \leq 1000$

The first line of the input contains an integer $T$ (between $1$ and $100$, inclusive), which describes the number of testcases. Each testcase has 1 line, which contains 2 integers $A$ (between $1$ and $100$, inclusive) and $B$ (between $1$ and $50$, inclusive).
$0 < T \leq 100$ ,
$1 \leq A \leq 100$, 
 $1 \leq B \leq 50$

The first line of the input contains an integer $T$ (between $1$ and $100$, inclusive), which describes the number of testcases. Each testcase has 1 line, which contains a single integer $N$ (between $1$ and $100$, inclusive).
$0 < T \leq 100$ ,
$1 \leq N \leq 100$

The first line of the input contains an integer $T$ (between $1$ and $100$, inclusive), which describes the number of testcases. Each testcase has 1 line, which contains a single integer $N$ (between $0$ and $10^9$, inclusive).
$0 < T \leq 100$, 
$0 \leq N \leq 10^9$
